TopicTitle: How many people have or will be upgrading for KSP2?

Articles.Content:
A discord I belong to (EJ_SA) at least 5 people have upgraded after the minimum/recommended specs came out for KSP2.

I was wondering how many people here have already done or are planning to do so therefore I have created a poll.

Darn it. I would have liked another option of no upgrade.

Edited February 22, 2023 by Anth12

I upgraded because it was time to replace my gaming laptop (i5, Nvidia 965M, 16GB ram), not because of KSP2 specifically. Saved up for about a year and a half to do it, sat on a waiting list for my video card while the mining thing was starting to wind down (was a nice surprise when I got the email). Now it's an i7-12700KF, EVGA 3070ti, 64 GB ram. I'll be running the game at 1080P because I still find it hard to pick out pixels on a 32" curved monitor.

I'll have to see if any of my current systems can run it at playable frame rates. If not, it's a disappointing reality that I'll have to pay more for the video card than I would for the rest of the components.
Yeah video cards cost a lot even before the mining thing happened.
Premature to make a call at this point.  I hope no one runs out and drops $1000 (or more) upgrading just for this game based on the suggested specs before EA even ships.

While I wont be upgrading before launch on the 24th, I will be in the market for a new laptop in a few months. So I'm definitely going to get something that's decent.

I've wanted to upgrade from my (barely above minimum requirements) RX 5700 for a year or so but I chose a small form-factor case when I did this build years ago and upgrading has been physically impossible. I'm using this as an excuse opportunity to move components into a rackmount chassis and stick it in my rack. The chassis I ordered is backordered for several weeks, though, so I'm going to be using this 5700 for at least that long.

All this to say, I guess my answer is "No upgrade before launch, but likely GPU and PSU well after release".
